networking

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • networking.Client
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Server.ServerClient

    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    The Client class is the back-end foundation for the client-server architecture. It contains the essential features required to represent a client. To fully utilize this class' capabilities, it is preferable to extend the class to fine-tune the client. The data transmission is handled by the NetworkCommunication class, which runs on its own thread.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mohammad Alali
    See Also:
    NetworkCommunication

      Nested Classes

      (package private) class  Client.ClientThread
      The ClientThread class manages the networking transmission on a separate thread.

    • Method Detail

      • resetInstance

        final void resetInstance()
        Used internally to reset the instance's variables. It will terminate the connection and its streams, and stop the communication thread.
        Since:
        1.0

      • connect

        public final void connect(java.lang.String ipAddress,
                          int port)
        Connects the client instance to the specified hostName and port. If the client is already connected to any connection, this method will abort early and do nothing. The following methods will get triggered:
        • onConnected(String, int) - if the connection was successful
        • onFailedToConnect(String, int) - if the connection was a failure
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - - the IP address to connect to
        port - - the port to connect to
        Since:
        1.0

      • disconnect

        public final void disconnect()
        Disconnect the client from the server. If already disconnected, the method will terminate early and do nothing. The onDisconnected(String, int) method will be triggered on a successful disconnection.
        Since:
        1.0

      • disconnect

        final void disconnect(boolean notifyDisconnection)
        Disconnect the client from the server. The parameter notifyDisconnection is used as follows:
        • true - if the disconnection request was made locally.
        • false - if disconnection request was made remotely.
        Parameters:
        notifyDisconnection - - a flag of whether the disconnection request was made locally or remotely
        Since:
        1.0

      • isConnected

        public final boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connection status of the client.
        Returns:
        true if the client is connected to the server; false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0

      • getCommunication

        public final NetworkCommunication getCommunication()
        If the client is connected to a server, this method will return the network communication instance of the client that aids in transmitting and receiving data from the server. And if the client is not connected, this method will return null.
        Returns:
        the network communication instance with server, if the client is connected; otherwise, returns null
        Since:
        1.0

      • getSocket

        protected final java.net.Socket getSocket()
        Returns the socket reference of the client. If there is no connection, null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the socket of the client
        Since:
        1.0

      • run

        private final void run()
        The run method handles the incoming networking transmission. This method should never be explicitly called as it automatically handled by the Client.ClientThread class, which calls this method on a separate thread.

        Incoming data will trigger the onReceivedData(NetworkSerializable) method, where the user is able to override and handle the data as he or she wishes.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Client.ClientThread

      • onConnected

        protected void onConnected(java.lang.String ipAddress,
                           int port)
        This method is triggered automatically when the client has successfully connected to a server via the connect(String, int) method.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - - the IP address of the server we connected to
        port - - the port of the server we connected to
        Since:
        1.0

      • onDisconnected

        protected void onDisconnected(java.lang.String ipAddress,
                              int port)
        This method is triggered automatically when the client has successfully disconnected from a server via the disconnect() method.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - - the IP address of the server we disconnected from
        port - - the port of the server we disconnected from
        Since:
        1.0

      • onFailedToConnect

        protected void onFailedToConnect(java.lang.String ipAddress,
                                 int port)
        This method is triggered automatically when the client has failed to connect to a server via the connect(String, int) method.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - - the attempted IP address of the server
        port - - the attempted port of the server
        Since:
        1.0

      • onReceivedData

        protected <T extends NetworkSerializable> void onReceivedData(T data)
        This method is triggered automatically when the client has received data from the server. The data received is a class that implements the NetworkSerializable interface.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the data received
        Parameters:
        data - - the data object received from the server
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        NetworkSerializable
